author: ubiodee
title: RemoStart: Africa Job Shadowing
description: No African country has met its SDG goal for decent work and economic growth and reduced inequalities. With a teeming youth population, how can we convert her population to talents for economic growth?

f6_assessments.q0: We note that the central idea of the proposal aims to create a solution to a latent problem on the African continent. In fact, there are comparatively few job opportunities compared to other continents, and blockchain technology can be of great use in improving this, both in the aforementioned way and in other ways that we will discuss. With that, we have that the proposal is adequately allocated in this challenge. In addition, given the initial intention of the project, the budget being requested seems adequate. The success of this proposal helps both in the development of the African continent and in increasing the visibility of Cardano's technologies.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the scope that the project plans to reach, we have that a possible problem would be the adoption, from the beginning, of actions that are too large for its implementation. But on the contrary, we see the coherent choice of building a pilot plan first, which is being divided into three phases. We also noticed that these phases are well organized, starting from simple actions, from the implementation of initial concepts of the idea, and progressively evolving until reaching the stages of testing and corrections. One of the positive points of the feasibility plan is the team of professionals, we realized that they have a very wide range of knowledge, including not only people involved in development, but also people who have experience in monitoring processes and HR. In addition, their CVs were made available so that their skills could be proven. In terms of budget detail, we have consistent capital distributions, without any over-allocations. And as this project relies on considerable traction from users, it's good to see that special attention has been paid to this aspect, with approximately $7,000 being allocated to marketing. Additionally, we see that the project has a very well structured website, which helps to expose the idea and increase confidence around the project and its viability.
f6_assessments.q2: Finally, when we are going to analyze the auditability of a project, it is always interesting when there are clear metrics that indicate the evolution of the project by monitoring important characteristics of the project. And here we observe the presence of these metrics, such as the number of people participating in the project and the rating of the product. It is also interesting to see how the perception of success was built. We noticed that numerical goals were established that help in defining the success or not of the project. Such targets even relate to the previously defined metrics.

f6_assessments.q0: Finding a decent job to sustain livelihood is one of the major challenges in Africa at the moment. This proposal seeks to create a platform that will develop African youth and prepare them for global job opportunities and that is great. Since it is a Cardano powered platform they are proposing, it means anyone who signups on the platform automatically participates in Cardano ecosystem and there is a high possibility of adoption of Cardano by most people who signups. The proposal meets the setting of the challenge in this way. If this proposal is well executed there will be a great impact both on the continent and the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal presents details on team members and also provides relevant links to their experience and that is good. There is a detailed plan indicating the phases of the project, the timelines for various activities and milestone to track progress and achievement. The budget is well broken down with intemized list of resources, activities and proposed expenditure. With these put together I think this proposal if funded will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: I like how this proposer details the Key performance indicators, the milestones and what success looks like. These details make it easy for anyone at all audit the progress and completion of this project. Kudos to the proposers.

f6_assessments.q0: The authors of the proposal acknowledge that no country in Africa has achieved the SDG goals of stable employment and economic growth as well as reducing inequality. The author proposes the idea of ​​building a job verification platform powered by the Cardano blockchain. Proposal, challenging impact. Ecosystems are not only meant to promote technological leaps forward, but also establish other positive impacts on the planet, such as: environment, education, economy, gender equality, ... all for people, communities, developed societies and developed ecosystems. I think the proposal was described in detail. 85% of Africans live on a salary of $5 a day according to the world bank. Many Africans lack the skills, experience and technical know-how needed for global companies and startups. So the author builds an employment support platform powered by the Cardano blockchain. Use this platform to learn and gain initial work experience after being linked to the remote working global. The author also estimates that it will affect 10,000 Africans in 6 months and 1,000,000 within 5 years. Besides, the author of the proposal also recognizes the possible risks. At the same time, there are solutions to reduce risks when the proposal is implemented.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the plan of the proposal, the author provides us with background information to evaluate this section. The first is about the route. The proponent cites the objectives to be achieved in 3 stages. and explained in great detail. Phase 1: Build the product (September 31 to October 31). Stage 2: Accumulation period (November 1 to December 31). Stage 3: Deployment and monitoring. In each stage, the author analyzes the work in detail. We see that the main author of the idea, has almost gone to work. This conveys a lot of confidence in the author's involvement in the project. We know what work will be done, where, in space and time. Next is the budget. The proposal asks for $40,000. In my opinion, the value requested is quite reasonable given the complexity and time of the project. The author has provided a very detailed budget table. The budgets are divided, and allocated to each job, personnel, time... in 3 phases. Finally, about the core team members. We know the members are all people with the right skills and experience to do the work on the project. At the same time, the author also provides a text presentation about each member, and attaches a link to let us know more about the history and experience of the members that the proposal has presented. In general, the plan of the proposal is very good, the budget is transparent and the members are skilled and experienced, increasing the feasibility of the proposal. Proposal is highly feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: From the experience of the members and the proposed plan, the kPI can determine the successful progress and what needs to be achieved of the project. A clear, transparent budget boosts the sustainable power of an entirely new proposition. The author provides indicators to measure the successful progress of the project. Rate products every 2 months. We know what will be done to achieve the end result, which is what is expected, is the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem described in this proposal is closely aligned with the challenge. The team has done a great job by putting the proposal at the right challenge. The proposal clearly provides a precise solution to the problem by building a job shadowing platform powered by the Cardano blockchain for Africans. This will lead to the indirect onboarding of 10000 Africans into Cardano.  
Also, the Cardano community from their block diagram shows everything will be done on the Cardano blockchain, this means that everyone onboarded on the platform has indirectly onboarded to a Cardano utility solution. Both talents and the startups onboarded onto the community.
This I think is something that has the potential to offer thousands of individuals skills training and on hand job skills to contribute enormously onto the ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge seeks to address the challenge of adoption, a key object of the grow Cardano, grow Africa challenge setting. Primarily, the project is designed to address the  unemployment crisis in Africa by linking unemployed graduate to startups and businesses. Competitive advantage to the Cardano ecosystem is to eventually help drive awareness creation and adoption rate of Cardano blockchain based solution across Africa. Considering that this is an ambitious project, I prefer the team specify which community or country would be the starting point and also, I suggest the team consider a more strategic and advanced offline marketing strategy that would put the platform as a preferred choice for jobseekers. Having developed the platform, the team can consider workshop for students and unemployed graduates(to educate them on the platform) and also consider the traditional media to attract users. Apart from that, I suggest the team present a more detailed plan and package that would convince and attract startups to this initiative.
f6_assessments.q1: A preview of the project gives me much confidence of the feasibility of this project. From the roadmap to budget and to the team experience, we see a well-defined approach presented here for the feasibility of the project. From the  roadmap, the proposers clearly tells us what would be done to achieve thegoal of the project. Within the roadmap are timelines indicating the stages for the project and the events for each stage. Also, the project presents a more thorough budget breakdown that points out each item with their budget allocation. For emphasis, I think the structure of the roadmap and budget is well designed to provide the needed guidance from start to finish of the project. Given the team’s attached links to their profile, I am convinced of the professionalism and transparency of the team. Finally, I see a team with solid expertise and experience within the IT field and  a few in a other areas. However, based on my preview of the proposal, I see the need of a marketing executive here, since the project looks a bit new. This could be crucial in driving the project to a larger audience.
f6_assessments.q2: “What’s the number of talents on-boarded on our platform, what is the number of talents who were linked to shadow for a startup, what is the number of persons who completed their shadowing program, how many of the talents who completed their shadowing program were retained by those startups or we were able to further connect to job opportunities or sound jobs by themselves”, are the main KPIs adopted to audit the progress and success of the project. Are these KPIs the best metrics for this project? These KPIs are not only best fit for this project but also has a direct connection with the success the team intend to achieve. Therefore, they can help monitor and track the progress and success of this project. More importantly, the team states that their website is the best platform to get these information. Again, I would have appreciated it, if the proposer makes the report available to the catalyst community.
